pros: There are some really good people at Manchester Adventhealth, but when you run into the bad ones they are unlike anything you have ever experienced. Beautiful area, with clean facilities, and excellent corporate support.
cons: CEO changes every 2/3 years, and no one local or from Kentucky ever holds the position. This creates a lack of investment in staff and providers from chief officers. Must be Adventist to hold upper administrative positions, CEO, CNO, etc. ALOT of buddy systems, with some non-qualified people holding positions because of who they are friends with, married to, or related to. Lack of proper care for the elderly, addicted, or critically ill. Not at all diverse in staff, providers, or management.

job_title: Clinical Informatics Director in Manchester, KY
pros:
I love where I work and appreciate the atmosphere of family culture including caring for patients as I would care for my own daughter.  The ability to pray with patients, family members, and team member is encouraged and supported.  The mission is lived here and not just the writing on the wall.  I say the following to new members, “Welcome to the team and we are happy to have you join us” as it is lived here and felt through the interacts in every department.  I’ve lived in Kentucky for over a decade and worked for AdventHealth Manchester for over 7 of those years.  Money doesn’t keep me in the position I’m in at the hospital, it’s the “team” work displayed daily as we truly are like family.  The increased services offered and expanding further into even more rural areas in our community to reach patients where they live means so much to me and especially to our patients, so they can receive the treatment they need which is a beautiful thing for our community.  The leadership strives for improvement in 2019 have continued to make a positive difference to our team. Proud of where I work!   
The organization’s commitment to providing our community with quality affordable patient care through values based on the mission purpose of “Extending the Healing Ministry of Christ”.  The team commitment to delivering Wholistic, Exceptional, Connected, Affordable & Viable care through the AdventHealth service standards and the culture of our amazing team, are the reasons why I’m a dedicated team member. Approachable leadership determined to improvement, expanding the services offered here to keep patients from having to travel to receive services they now receive here through the telemedicine services such as high risk OBGYN, UK neurology, and advanced ICU to name a few.  
Being part of a larger organization, AdventHealth, our community benefits by providing the latest technology to our Southeastern Kentucky’s rural hospital patients.  Advanced technology allows increased patient safety, decrease in negative patient outcomes, analytical methods to improve processes quickly through real time patient data in which to make the quickest and greatest impact to benefit our patients.  Our beliefs and values to quality & service excellence, community wellbeing, inclusiveness, stewardship, and high ethical standards truly makes working daily for this organization a pleasure.  Extending the mission to the community through outreach partnerships to build two water kiosks is one example of the many volunteer projects performed by our Managers on a Mission.
cons: The economic challenges to serving the poorest population with decrease financial resource reimbursement as Medicare/Medicaid is the main method of payment for services.  Team members are responsible for more here than other facilities. (The pros far out weigh the cons….. as we provide more with less which contributes to the swell of pride I feel in working here!)

pros: Great family-like team. People motivated by mission and doing the right thing. AdventHealth is a great company with a beautiful mission and culture. Patients in this community really appreciate the hospital. There is so much opportunity to do good in this community. Safety and quality are very important to everyone here. It is a fun place to work and leadership really values everyone's opinions.
cons: It is a small and tough rural market
